summary: An email chain from July 12, 2019, involving an FBI agent and a former agent discussing a potential male victim of Jeffrey Epstein who claims to have information about high-level government figures, including a former president. The email also references a deceased retired police officer and a murdered Arkansas senator.

persons.name: Osborn
persons.context: Mentioned as being cc'd and leading the investigation into the potential victim's information regarding Epstein.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: Mentioned as being cc'd and leading the investigation into the potential victim's information regarding Epstein.

persons.name: Arkansas Senator
persons.context: Referenced as having been in contact with the email sender about a CPS corruption case and having information on child trafficking before being murdered.

connections.description: Both are leading the FBI investigation into the potential victim's information regarding Epstein.

events.title: Email about potential Epstein victim
events.description: An email is sent discussing a potential male victim of Jeffrey Epstein who claims to have information about high-level government figures and the trafficking process.

events.title: Murder of Arkansas Senator
events.description: Reference to a now-murdered Arkansas senator who had information on child trafficking and was in contact with the email sender about a CPS corruption case.

keyFacts: A potential male victim of Jeffrey Epstein claims to have information about the entire trafficking process and specifics on high-level government people, including one former president.
A female retired police officer who was working on human trafficking with an investigative journalist is now deceased.
The email sender was in contact with a now-murdered Arkansas senator about a CPS corruption case, and the senator had information on child trafficking.
The FBI is provided with contact information for the potential victim and is asked to vet his story.
The email chain demonstrates an attempt to route victim information directly to the FBI's investigative team.
